their best to add another $3.5 TRILLION to federal spending. They failed, but if they had succeeded, inflation would be even higher than it is today, and inflation today is at a 40 year high.

Look, a squirrel! This is the White House‚Äôs statement about my recent tweets. They understandably want to muddy the topic. They know inflation hurts the neediest the most. But unions aren‚Äôt causing inflation and neither are wealthy people.  Remember the Administration tried‚Ä¶

25 years ago yesterday, AMZN went public. As the Grateful Dead would say, ‚ÄúWhat a long, strange trip it‚Äôs been.‚Äù

It‚Äôs been far from smooth. Lots of risk-taking, lots of invention, lots of mistakes, so much we still have to do better. I wouldn‚Äôt trade the ride for anything.

In fact, the administration tried hard to inject even more stimulus into an already over-heated, inflationary economy and only Manchin saved them from themselves. Inflation is a regressive tax that most hurts the least affluent. Misdirection doesn‚Äôt help the country.

The newly created Disinformation Board should review this tweet, or maybe they need to form a new Non Sequitur Board instead. Raising corp taxes is fine to discuss. Taming inflation is critical to discuss. Mushing them together is just misdirection.
Slide decks are maybe useful for persuasion ‚Äî think sales calls. But you don‚Äôt want that for internal decision meetings.

Slide decks hide can shallow thinking. Narratively structured memos are harder to write because they require better thinking. It‚Äôs worth it.

We‚Äôve just opened a second humanitarian aid hub to help Ukrainian refugees ‚Äî this one in Poland. Like the first one we opened in Slovakia, it‚Äôs a fulfillment center dedicated to this issue, using our logistics and distribution experience to help.

Today the Washington Post and the world lost an exceptional journalist and remarkable man: long-time Editorial Page Editor Fred Hiatt. I will miss his thoughtfulness, professionalism, and warm friendship. Our thoughts are with his beloved family at this difficult time.
Welcome aboard, Michael!
(2/2) This year‚Äôs grants go to 32 groups led by experts who are making a difference in their communities, and the funds will help them further expand their important work.

For the fourth year in a row, the Bezos Day 1 Families Fund is making donations to organizations helping families in need across the U.S. These grants will provide support including housing, food, clothing, and other resources to help families get back on their feet. (1/2)
(2/2) Our deepest sympathies are with his partner, Leah, and all his loved ones. The world lost you too soon, Glen.

Such a tragic loss. Warm and full of life, Glen made us laugh and lit up the room. He was a visionary, and an innovator ‚Äì a true leader. Lauren and I are heartbroken and will remember the precious time we got to spend together. (1/2)

At #COP26, Lauren and I discussed conservation of land and sea with leaders from Colombia, Ecuador, Panama, Costa Rica, and Bolivia. Together, they oversee one of the most diverse regions on earth. The @BezosEarthFund is working with them to help create the largest (1/2)

Wonderful meeting with Tuntiak Katan from the Shuar tribe in Ecuador and Solange Bandiaky-Badji, from the Rights and Resources Institute. Indigenous peoples are custodians of over a third of the world‚Äôs tropical forests. We must champion their efforts to protect our planet.

The Prince of Wales has been involved in fighting climate change and protecting our beautiful world far longer than most. We had a chance to discuss these important issues on the eve of #COP26 ‚Äî looking for solutions to heal our world, and how the @BezosEarthFund can help.

After many failures and setbacks in gaming we have a success. So proud of the team for the persistence. View setbacks as helpful obstacles that drive learning. Whatever your goals are, don‚Äôt give up no matter how hard it gets. @playnewworld (1/2)

Good exchange of ideas on climate change with a lot of passion around preserving and restoring the natural world. There might also have been a side conversation about who‚Äôs better ‚Äî Asimov or Clarke. The meeting was useful and enjoyable. Thank you, @BorisJohnson.

Proud of the program we have in India to hire and train deaf associates at our delivery stations. Managers learn basic sign language to be able to communicate. Meeting this group was a moving experience for me.

Amazon partners with thousands of kirana stores all over India as delivery points. It‚Äôs good for customers, and it helps the shop owners earn additional income. Got to visit one in Mumbai. Thank you, Amol, for letting me deliver a package. #MSME

Just landed in India and spent a beautiful afternoon paying my respects to someone who truly changed the world. ‚ÄúLive as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." - Mahatma Gandhi.

Toured @LeeMontessori in Washington D.C. with a team from Day 1 Academies. It was great to meet these kids ‚Äî they‚Äôre energetic and energizing. Lee is doing an amazing job unleashing their love of learning.

Picture perfect flight @BlueOrigin. And this vehicle has now flown to space & back six times making this a new milestone. We carried 23 payloads today including thousands of postcards from kids all over the world for @ClubforFuture. Keep them coming kids & we‚Äôll keep flying them!

Nice! Amazon ranked #1 best managed company. Definitely the result of strong teamwork from people who care deeply and passionately about customers, their fellow employees, and the environment. Huge thank you and kudos to all Amazonians.

Excited to announce this year's Bezos Day One grants. Thank you to these 32 organizations in 23 states working to end homelessness. I recently spent time with the amazing team at Community of Hope in Washington, D.C. ‚Äì one of last year‚Äôs grantees.

Congrats to David & all the veterans graduating from the Amazon Apprenticeship program who are now in technical careers! They join the more than 21,000 veterans and military spouses working at Amazon. Huge thank you to them and all who‚Äôve served. #VeteransDay #AmazonWarriors

Dropped in on an #AmazonFutureEngineer class at Dunbar H.S. in D.C. today. We‚Äôre committed to bringing more resources to kids from underserved communities, and I‚Äôm proud to say we‚Äôre now funding computer science in more than 2,000 high schools across the U.S. #NextGeneration

Thank you to our customers who donated relief items for a second Amazon Air plane of humanitarian aid. Together, more than 400,000 Amazon-donated & customer-donated items have been provided to those affected by #HurricaneDorian in the Bahamas & the US.

Yesterday the first Amazon Air plane loaded with relief items arrived in Nassau, Bahamas to help victims of #HurricaneDorian. The cargo weight was 72,728 lbs, with approx. 19,300 items on board. Huge thanks to the teams across Amazon who made this happen.

Shout out to the new Amazonians who let me drop by their New Hire Orientation today. Incredible to welcome so many smart and passionate people from all over the world. I‚Äôm looking forward to our #AmazonCareerDay events tomorrow!
Visited the amazing @Nia_House Montessori in Nashville with @mike_m_george. Learned a lot that‚Äôs going to help Day 1 Academies. By the way, ‚ÄúNia‚Äù means ‚Äúpurpose‚Äù in Swahili. Very cool.
Today, we announced that we added 24 schools in #Nashville to our #AmazonFutureEngineer program. Loved celebrating the great news by building robots with students from Madison Middle School.

We're sending two Amazon Air planes packed with tens of thousands of Amazon-donated and customer-donated relief items to support those impacted by #HurricaneDorian in the Bahamas. Thanks to all the teams who are making this possible.

First hotfire of our #BE7 lunar landing engine just yesterday at Marshall Space Flight Center. Data looks great and hardware is in perfect condition. Test went full planned duration ‚Äì 35 seconds. Kudos to the whole @BlueOrigin team and grateful to @NASA_Marshall for all the help!
Happy Father‚Äôs Day. You‚Äôre there for me always, and I feel it. I love you, Dad.

MacKenzie is going to be amazing and thoughtful and effective at philanthropy, and I‚Äôm proud of her. Her letter is so beautiful. Go get ‚Äòem MacKenzie.

My dad‚Äôs journey to the U.S. shows how people come together to help each other. We got a chance to celebrate him last night for the opening of the Statue of Liberty‚Äôs new museum. This is his story.

At the Statue of Liberty, where my dad‚Äôs being honored with a Liberty Star as part of the new museum‚Äôs opening. When he came here from Cuba at 16, not only was he all alone, but he only spoke Spanish. His grit, determination, and optimism are inspiring. #StatueofLibertyMuseum

We‚Äôre investing $1.5 billion in our new air hub to get you your packages faster. Three million square feet, and it‚Äôs going to create 2,000 jobs. And if you‚Äôre guessing that driving a front loader was fun, you‚Äôre right! #amazon #prime
I‚Äôm lucky enough to call her my mom. She‚Äôs kind, patient, supportive, and has always encouraged me to stay curious. Happy Mother‚Äôs Day, Mom!
Blue Origin is building the infrastructure needed to unleash the next generation of dreamers. I met these young people today, and the future is in great hands. #BlueMoon @clubforfuture
Congrats to the whole @blueorigin team!

Been an honor & pleasure having Tom Alberg on Amazon‚Äôs Board. Tom joined in 1996 and has been with us ever since - over 22 years. I‚Äôll miss his sound judgment, deep well of business & life experience, and his quick wit. He's a smart business person and even better human. Thx Tom!

I have outstanding news to ring in 2019. Former Alexa VP & long-time Amazonian Mike George has agreed to lead the Day 1 Academies Fund. Mike is a true builder who knows how to start from scratch, and he‚Äôll bring tremendous energy, grit, and passion to the job. Thank you, Mike!

Excited to announce the first annual grants from the Bezos Day 1 Families Fund. $97.5 million to 24 organizations doing needle-moving work on family homelessness. Congrats to the recipients ‚Äì we know you‚Äôll spend the money wisely and with heart.

Yep, that‚Äôs me. I was lucky to be exposed to tech and coding at a young age. Inspired a lifelong love of invention. I hope the new Amazon Future Engineer program does the same for some kids today.

Very sad to hear of Paul Allen‚Äôs passing. His passion for invention and pushing forward inspired so many. He was relentless to the end. My heart goes out to Paul‚Äôs family and friends.

Dog sledding above the Arctic Circle in Norway. Jim Lovell says it‚Äôs not that you go to heaven when you die, but ‚Äúyou go to heaven when you‚Äôre born.‚Äù Earth is the best planet in our solar system. We go to space to save the Earth. @BlueOrigin #NoPlanB #GradatimFerociter #EarthDay

At @BestBuy catching up with CEO Hubert Joly and announcing our collaboration on the next generation of smart TVs. Couldn‚Äôt ask for a better partner, and the product is killer. Full Alexa integration: ‚ÄúAlexa, watch ABC‚Äù or ‚ÄúAlexa, watch Westworld.‚Äù #FireTVEdition

New test video of Blue‚Äôs 550K lbf thrust, ox-rich staged combustion, LNG-fueled BE-4 engine. The test is a mixture ratio sweep at 65% power level and 114 seconds in duration. Methane (or LNG) has proved to be an outstanding fuel choice. @BlueOrigin #GradatimFerociter
